remarks: The group power of a product is the composition of the powers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
gxnn0mul.1 $e |- X = ran G $.
gxnn0mul.2 $e |- P = ( ^g ` G ) $.
gxmul $p |- ( ( G e. GrpOp /\ A e. X /\ ( J e. ZZ /\ K e. ZZ ) ) -> ( A P ( J x. K ) ) = ( ( A P J ) P K ) ) $.
